task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 172°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to inspect the full façade and roofline of the south-facing main building to estimate its height, so I should tilt the view upward first.
The view is now facing north instead of the target south-facing building, so I should rotate back to 172° to re-center the main building while keeping the upward pitch to see its top.
To estimate total height I need to see the roofline and upper stories clearly, so I should tilt up while staying aimed south at the building.
The camera has again ended up facing north; to view the target building to the south I must rotate to ~172° while keeping the upward pitch.
Rather than tilting up (which seems to reset heading), I should estimate height from the current full-building view: it appears ~3 stories plus roof, roughly 12 m total.
